channel.title: ECE586 Vector Space and Applications on Writeplace
channel.description: Recent content in ECE586 Vector Space and Applications on Writeplace

item.description: Chapter 1 Logic and Set Theory # Logic Set Theory Functions Reading: EF 1.1-1.3 A proof is a demonstration that, assuming certain axioms, some statement is necessarily true. An unproven proposition for which there is some sort of empirical is known as a conjecture. Propositional Logic (0th-order logic) # Statement # statement = proposition A statement is the content of an assertion, can be either true or false.
